This Validation Plan (VP) serves to identify the activities required for validating the following Siemens Polarion initiatives in <Company Name or Site Name>:

·       New Polarion implementation for <Company Name or Site Name>

Specifically, this document describes:

·       WHAT documentation/deliverables will be generated as part of this effort

·       WHO will be responsible for completion, review, and approval of validation deliverables

·       HOW this documentation will be produced/created

The scope of this validation effort is limited to validating Polarion’s intended use for <Company Name or Site Name>. Specifically, this effort includes validation of the following high-level functionalities in Polarion:

·       Requirements Management

·       Risk Analysis and Risk Management

·       Test and Test methods validation

·       Production Control Plan

·       e-signatures for review and approval of tasks

 

·       FDA Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 21 Part 11

·       ISPE GAMP Good Practice Guide – Data Integrity by Design

Polarion is a 21 CFR Part 11 compliant ALM system with wide adoption in Medical Device industry. It is developed by industry leading software manufacturer Siemens Digital Industries Software (SISW). As a software manufacturer, SISW has numerous quality and security certifications including but not limited to:

·       ISO 9001

·       ISO 14001

·       ISO 45001

·       IEC 62443-4-1

·       ISO 26262

A risk-based approach, based on FDA’s draft guidance “Computer Software Assurance” and ISPE GAMP Good Practice Guide – Data Integrity by Design, shall be leveraged to validate Polarion for <Company Name >.


 

Polarion is a GAMP 5 Category 4 configurable system. Most of the system is out of the box and / or configured with a few elements which may be customized to meet <Company Name>requirements. Per the Computer Software Assurance approach, system functionalities in Polarion shall be assessed for functional risk. Validation testing shall then be commensurate to the level of risk associated to system functionalities.

This industry standard risk-based approach is detailed below:

The following deliverables shall be created in support of this validation effort. Changes, if any, to this list of deliverables shall be documented in the Validation Summary Report.

Deliverable / Activity
Comments
Validation Plan
 Validation Plan (this document) for governing the validation of Polarion in <Company Name or Site Name>
Requirements Specification
 Requirements Specification for identifying the requirements for Polarion implementation
System Risk Assessment
 System Level Risk Assessment for calculating the overall risk level of the system
21 CFR Part 11 Assessment
 21 CFR Part 11 Assessment for assessing and identifying 21 CFR Part 11 controls of Polarion
Design Specification, as required, for custom components
 Design document that includes the design elements for custom components in Polarion modules
Functional Risk Assessment 
 Functional Risk Assessment for identifying the risk level of individual functionalities. Risk ratings from this assessment shall be used to drive the level of functional testing. Functional risk ratings are included within the requirement level and Risk-based Test Strategy report.
Design Review Summary Report
 A document that summarizes the review and initial acceptance of system design by Business Representatives as meeting the system specifications.
Risk Based Test Strategy Report
 A live report in Polarion which includes a summary of requirements and their associated risk ratings and testing types.
Qualification Protocol
 
 Qualification Protocol defines test strategy and environments with rationale of how the extent of testing is determined based on Functional Risk Assessment.
Installation Qualification (IQ) test cases 
 IQ test cases for verifying the installation of Polarion
Operation Qualification (OQ) test cases
 OQ test cases for testing the functionality of Polarion. 
Performance Qualification (PQ) / UAT test cases
 PQ / UAT test cases for testing high level end to end use case scenarios for the implementation.
Defects, as applicable
 
 Logging, tracking and closing defects that occur during validation test execution.
Traceability Matrix
 Traceability Matrix for mapping requirements to the corresponding design documents and test cases. This will be a live report in Polarion.
Validation Summary Report
 Validation Summary Report for summarizing the validation

Environments
Development / Validation Activities
Development Environment
 Development environment is utilized to support end to end development activities including creation of prototypes and configuring / customizing the system per <Company Name > requirements.
Test / QA Environment
 Test / QA environment is utilized to support validation activities including generation / execution / approval of end to end validation deliverables in Polarion CSA template. This environment is also used to execute OQ and UAT / PQ Testing.
Production Environment
 Production Environment is utilized to support the business usage of the system. Upon issuance of Validation Summary Report, this environment shall be released for production usage by business users.

This Validation Plan (VP) may be closed through a Validation Summary Report (VSR) once the following conditions are satisfied:

·       All validation deliverables identified in this Validation Plan have been completed and approved. Any exceptions and / or clarifications have been documented appropriately in Validation Summary Report.

·       All test cases have been executed and reviewed for accuracy and approved.

·       All defects are resolved, retesting performed as necessary and approved.

·       All training materials have been created and user training is complete

·       All standard operating procedures and work instructions have been written and approved

·       The IT Change Management Work Instruction is being followed for this implementation

·       The Validation Summary Report (VSR) has been written and approved with justifications and / or rationale for fit for intended use, as applicable.
